isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - FULLER 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - ASSEMBLE - SYNCHRONIZER

note.para: Assembly should be done on a clean, flat surface slightly lower than your waist.

step1.para: Place the larger low range synchronizer ring on the bench with the pins facing upward.

With the recessed side up, place the sliding clutch over the low range synchronizer pins. Make sure the pins on the low range synchronizer are inserted through the chamfered holes on the sliding clutch bottom.
Install a spring in each of the three (3) holes in the high range synchronizer. The holes are horizontal to the pins.
Place the high range synchronizer ring over the three (3) pins on the low range synchronizer ring. Rotate the high range synchronizer counterclockwise until the springs are seated against the pins.
Cover the assembly with a shop rag. The rag will contain the springs if they shoot out of the synchronizer during compression at Step 6.

Place your hands on each side of the synchronizer assembly, and apply downward pressure while twisting the high range synchronizer counterclockwise. As the springs compress, the high range synchronizer will drop down over the low range synchronizer pins ( Figure 112).

figure.caption: Figure 112. Apply Downward Pressure While Twisting Counterclockwise
